alert.note: Alert for Caddo (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 25 at 1:28PM CST until further notice by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana... Cross Bayou At Cross Lake affecting Caddo Parish. For the Lakes...including Cross Lake...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Cross Bayou at Cross Lake. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM CST Thursday the stage was 171.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 172.5 feet. - Forecast...At 12:30 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 170.6 feet. Expect the lake to rise to near 172.0 feet by noon Friday. Secondary roads and camps in an around Cross Lake will see impacts from rising water. - Action stage is 172.5 feet. - Flood stage is 173.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at 130 PM CST.
